Posts.EditableText:
If you try to upload a game to the TextAdventures website with the same ID as an existing game with that ID, it will fail, telling you that there already is a game having that ID. (In other words, it won't let you.) So you need to generate a new ID if you copy a game and wish to upload it.

As far as IFDB goes, I assume if you wish to have two different games there, you'd need two different IDs for them as well.

If you're just copying things around on your hard drive, it doesn't matter if they have the same ID or not.

(Note: I've had problems in the past with the TA site, where I would upload a new rev of a game, and it wouldn't update the contents, no matter what I did on my browser side - cache, etc. But generating a new ID and then uploading forced an update. So I've found another use for the ID.)

Posts.EditableText: I think the idea of IFDB is that it's a collaborative wiki, so it's fine for people to submit listings of any game on there. That means it's worth checking for an existing listing before adding a new one. If there's already a listing for your game, you can edit it.
